Senate cleared a bipartisan, humanitarian aid bill to support children & families in crisis at the border. Admin first requested $$ 57 days ago & the situation has deteriorated since then. House needs to pass aid ASAP so @RealDonaldTrump can sign it into law this week. https://twitter.com/CNNPolitics/status/1143968527046627330¬†‚Ä¶
This is not that hard. But it‚Äôs become this horrible partisan issue that I think all of us are really frustrated with. It‚Äôs time to fix this.

This should not be about hurting @RealDonaldTrump & his presidential hopes for next year. This is about a group of kids that need help to reduce the incentive for them to cross the border illegally & take care of the folks that are already here.
Now we finally have an agreement on aid, & the House responds with a partisan bill & uses it to try to negotiate a vote on defense bill. Yet ANOTHER delay. You can‚Äôt have it both ways.
Every smuggler capitalizes on our refusal to fix Flores, & Congress won‚Äôt acknowledge it. And there‚Äôs been a dramatic slowdown to get humanitarian aid.
We all know the issue is Flores settlement, but we refuse to fix it

I have folks calling my office saying, "why don‚Äôt you care about the kids?‚Äù We see it on the news that border agents don‚Äôt care about the kids‚Äîbut what is being done to actually take care of the kids?

Then, yesterday, @SenSchumer was back on the floor criticizing @realDonaldTrump asking why aren‚Äôt we taking care of the kids? When @HSGAC has worked on it for months. We‚Äôve asked for it for months & all we got was we‚Äôll get to unrelated issues later.
Unrelated to humanitarian issues, translation. Let‚Äôs put it off until later.

On May 22, @SenSchumer was on the floor & said, ‚ÄúThe Democrats are ready to pass the bipartisan disaster relief package that‚Äôs already been agreed to & written, but we should pass the disaster agreement as is & return to unrelated issues at a later date."

After that, both Democrat and Republican leaders seemed hopeful that we could work together to address the humanitarian assistance at the border during consideration for supplemental funding for disaster areas.
On May 1, DHS & HHS sent another letter to say they are in a crisis moment. May 17, again they are at a critical moment.
But still nothing has happened. These children are not pawns.

These children are currently being used as pawns to try to hurt the Trump Administration, & my Democratic colleagues are trying to identify children that are not getting care, while at the same time slowing down the process of providing humanitarian aid.

Congress didn‚Äôt do anything. I‚Äôve had personal convos w/Dems & GOP Members-at what point do we admit the obvious statement that Obama & Trump Admins made? If we don‚Äôt resolve Flores settlement this will not get better b/c traffickers will cont to move children across border.
DHS went on to say ‚ÄúMy greatest concern is for the children, who are put at high risk by this emergency & who are arriving sicker than ever before, after traveling on the treacherous trek.‚Äù

On 3/28/19, DHS asked Congress to address emergency @ border. DHS- ‚ÄúWe now face a system-wide meltdown. DHS facilities are overflowing, agents & offers are stretched too thin, & the magnitude of arriving & detained aliens has increased the risk of life-threatening incidents.‚Äù

For years, Congress has neglected to do its job & fix our broken immigration system. But that inaction has shifted to direct refusal in recent months. We‚Äôve been given warnings, red flags, & alerts that we need to fix this problem, but we haven‚Äôt acted on them since the 90s.
My colleagues & I shared our clear frustration during a @HSGAC hearing on the treatment of children at the Southern Border.
Thanks for your leadership in moving the defense bill to the floor, @JimInhofe.

Thankful for the example of friendship & bipartisanship that @JimInhofe & @SenJackReed show while leading the @SASCMajority committee. We do not have to agree on everything to work on something, & the defense authorization bill (NDAA) is a prime example. https://twitter.com/nielslesniewski/status/1143506274497302528¬†‚Ä¶

26% of OK exports go to Canada & 13% go to Mexico‚Äîtrade is important to OK manufacturing, our ag industry, & families. US companies deserve a chance to petition their gov for import tax relief, & my bill‚Äîthe Import Tax Relief Act‚Äîwill set up a process to do just that.

As a nation, we demand transparency & humanity when other human organs & tissue are donated for research or life-saving operations. It‚Äôs reasonable to have the same integrity and ethical process for the use of human fetal tissue.

There is never a time that a child wasn‚Äôt a child. From the moment of conception, a child has their own DNA that is unique to them & will cont to have same DNA their entire life, separate from the mother or father. The only difference between a child in the womb & a 2yo is time.

Every human should be treated w/ dignity & respect, no matter their age. We cannot in one moment say that an unborn child is not a person but then recognize the humanity and value for the purpose of research.
Today the @RealDonaldTrump admin ended current contracts w/ UCSF, stopped new research at NIH, reevaluated outside research & considered alternatives for research of human fetal tissue.
